Definition: In this task, You're given a statement from a politician and your task is to generate the subject of the statement spoken by a Politician.

Positive Examples.input: Says the Annies List political group supports third-trimester abortions on demand.
Positive Examples.explanation: It's a correct subject of the statement because it talks about a political group supporting demans of abortions.

Positive Examples.input: In this last election in November, ... 63 percent of the American people chose not to vote, ... 80 percent of young people, (and) 75 percent of low-income workers chose not to vote.
Positive Examples.explanation: It's a correct subject of the statement because it talks about the percentage of different kinds of people who didn't choose to vote.

Positive Examples.input: The nuclear test conducted in our nation this time is the Earth's 2,054th nuclear test. The five permanent members of the U.N. Security Council have conducted 99.99 percent of the total nuclear tests.
Positive Examples.explanation: It's a correct subject of the statement because it talks about nuclear test that's been conducted in the nation.

Negative Examples.input: We just had the best year for the auto industry in America in history.
Negative Examples.explanation: It's a wrong subject of the subject. Because the subject talks about the success of an auto industry that year. So, the correct subject would be economy.

Negative Examples.input: We cut business taxes so today 70 percent of our businesses don't pay a business tax.
Negative Examples.explanation: It's a wrong subject of the subject. Because the subject talks about the business not paying taxes. So, the correct subject would be small business, taxes.

Negative Examples.input: Says a U.S. Supreme Court justice suggested that some U.S. cases will be decided based on South African law.
Negative Examples.explanation: It's a wrong subject of the subject. Because the subject talks about the suggestion of U.S. Supreme Court. So, the correct subject would be legal-issues,supreme-court.
